personal.name: Bode-Okunade A. B.
personal.title: Robotics and Embedded Systems Engineer
personal.companyDescription: a subsidiary of Proforce Defence Ltd focused on space technology, satellite systems, and advanced robotics research

bio.hero: As a hands-on engineer, I love building real systems. I feel most alive when wiring, programming, assembling, and making hardware come to life.
bio.researchInterests: My main interests lie in autonomous systems, robotics, embedded systems, AI-driven automation, computer vision, and control architectures for humanoid and autonomous robots.
bio.tagline: Welcome to my portfolio, a glimpse into my journey through robotics and intelligent systems engineering.

currentRole.name: Bode-Okunade Abdulsalam Babajide
currentRole.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
description: I am an Embedded Systems Engineer at Proforce Galaxies, where I design and integrate embedded control architectures for space and satellite technologies. My work focuses on subsystem interoperability, including On-Board Computer (OBC), Attitude Determination and Control (ADCS), Electrical Power System (EPS), and Payload Control Unit (PCU) development.

I hold a B.Eng. in Mechatronics Engineering (Robotics and Automation major) from the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta (FUNAAB), Nigeria, where my final year project, the development of an autonomous agricultural robot, was published in the IAES International Journal of Robotics and Automation.

My professional journey includes experience at Robotics and Artificial Intelligence Nigeria (RAIN), where I developed multiple robotic systems using ROS (Robot Operating System), embedded programming, and 3D printing technologies. I later served as a researcher and instructor in the robotics department. I also gained valuable industrial experience at KAM Industries Ltd and Nigerian Breweries PLC, working on automation systems and monitoring solutions for manufacturing equipment.

I am passionate about bridging the gap between theoretical engineering and practical implementation, with particular interest in autonomous systems, robotics, and embedded system design for challenging environments across diverse industries.

sections.heading: Current Role
sections.content:
At Proforce Galaxies, a subsidiary of Proforce Defence Ltd focused on advanced space and satellite technologies research and development, I design, develop, and integrate embedded control architectures focusing on subsystem interoperability, test-driven development, and low-level hardware-software integration. 



My work focuses on the different subsystems including On-Board Computer (OBC), Attitude Determination and Control (ADCS), Electrical Power System (EPS), and Payload Control Unit (PCU). I leverage my expertise in embedded systems, firmware programming, and hardware engineering to develop robust satellite control systems. Working with Linux and dedicated IDEs, I implement control algorithms and communication protocols for space applications. I also support the development of embedded systems for autonomous vehicles and contribute to satellite simulation and mission planning research, applying my knowledge of control systems and circuit analysis to ensure reliable operation in challenging space environments.

sections.heading: Early Career and Education
sections.content:
In my fourth year between 2022 and 2023, I spent my internship training at Robotics and Artificial Intelligence Nigeria (RAIN), Africa's top robotics and AI research and development institution, as a Robotics and Automation Developer under the supervision of Dr. Olusola Ayoola. I worked on the design, simulation, and prototyping of multiple robotic systems including drones, unmanned ground rovers, manipulator arms, and legged robots. This experience allowed me to develop proficiency in Python, C++, ROS (Robot Operating System), and microcontroller/processor programming for robot control and monitoring. I extensively used CAD tools like Fusion 360 and SolidWorks for mechanical design, combined with 3D printing for rapid prototyping. 



After my internship, I was retained as a Support Staff where I taught and supervised trainees' research implementations in the robotics department. This role enhanced my leadership, communication, and teamwork skills as I guided students through complex robotics projects.

sections.heading: Academic Background
sections.content:
I got my bachelor's degree in Mechatronics Engineering (Robotics and Automation major) from the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta (FUNAAB), Nigeria in December 2023. During my time in school, I was involved in various projects as requirements for different courses, such as a fire detection and alarm system in my second year, a controllable electric screwdriver in my third year, an automated attendance system using motion detection in my fourth year, and my capstone final year project on the Design and Development of an unmanned ground vehicle for seed planting, a Robotic Seed Planter. These projects strengthened my foundation in circuit analysis, electrical circuit design, control systems, and embedded systems, while developing my problem-solving and creativity skills. I utilized MATLAB for system modeling and simulation, and applied my knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and automation integration to bring these projects to life. 



My final year project was later published in the IAES International Journal of Robotics and Automation (IJRA) in June 2024, under the supervision of Dr. Samuel Owoeye.

sections.heading: Industrial Experience
sections.content:
From 2024 to 2025 during my NYSC service year, I worked at KAM Industries Ltd, Nigeria's largest steel and allied products manufacturer, as an Electrical/Automation Engineer. I worked on the repair and maintenance of industrial equipment such as double girder cranes, pumps, motors, hydraulic systems, and electrical grid systems, under the supervision of Engrs. Naresh, Alok, Adams, Ahmed, and Sunil. This role deepened my understanding of electrical connections, circuit analysis, and industrial automation systems. I applied my adaptability and teamwork skills to work effectively in a multicultural engineering team, troubleshooting complex electrical and mechanical systems in a fast-paced high-pressure manufacturing environment.        



In 2021, my third year at FUNAAB, I interned at Nigerian Breweries PLC in Ibadan Nigeria. Working as an Automation Engineer under the supervision of Engr. Temple, I was responsible for the bi-weekly calibration of sensors across the factory using the BEAMEX MC5 calibrator, and the maintenance of the factory's automation systems. I also collaborated in the development of a pedestrian safety system for the logistics department using sensors and automation technologies, and created a real-time solution for an on-site CO2 leak, reportedly reducing production downtime by 50%. This experience kickstarted my skill development in automation, electrical circuit design, and problem-solving in real-world industrial applications.

sections.heading: Return to Research and Current Position
sections.content:
In 2025, I returned to RAIN as a Robotics Researcher and Tutor, teaching trainees in the robotics department in areas like 3D design using Fusion 360, electronics, microcontroller programming with C++ and Arduino IDE, Python programming, control systems, and robot kinematics. I utilized Platform.io, Visual Studio Code, and Arduino IDE for embedded development, ROS, Python, Electronics, and 3D printing to guide students through hands-on robotics projects. This role further developed my leadership, communication, and creativity as I mentored the next generation of robotics engineers. 

Then in July, I joined Proforce Galaxies as an Embedded Systems Engineer, where I continue to advance the field of space robotics and embedded systems, bringing together all my technical skills in embedded systems, IoT, automation, and control systems to tackle the challenges of space technology development.

work.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
work.description: Responsible for the architecture and development of embedded systems for space applications. Leading subsystem integration on satellite missions, including component selection, communication bus design, and software architecture planning.

work.title: Electrical/Automation Engineer
work.description: Worked on the repair and maintenance of industrial equipment including double girder cranes, pumps, motors, hydraulic systems, and electrical grid systems. Gained valuable experience in industrial automation and manufacturing processes. As a National Youth Service Corp Member at the time, this was my place of primary assignment.

work.title: Robotics and Automation Developer
work.description: I worked on the design, simulation, and prototyping of multiple robotic systems including drones, unmanned ground rovers, unmanned aerial vehicles, manipulator arms, and legged robots. After my training, I was retained as a Support Staff where I supervised trainees research implementations in the robotics department.

work.title: Automation Engineering Intern
work.description: Worked as an automation engineering intern responsible for bi-weekly calibration of sensors across the factory and maintenance of automation systems. Collaborated in developing a pedestrian safety system and created real-time solutions for CO2 leak detection.

teaching.title: Robotics Researcher and Instructor
teaching.description: Taught trainees in robotics department covering 3D design, electronics, microcontroller programming with C++, Python programming, control systems, and robot kinematics. Supervised student research implementations and project development.

teaching.title: Robotics Course Instructor
teaching.description: Taught students from JSS2 to SS3 the fundamentals of robotics such as mirocontroller programming, electronics, and basic circuit design.

volunteer.title: Member, NIESAT
volunteer.institution: Nigeria Innovative Engineers Scientists and Applied Technologists
volunteer.description: An NYSC Community Development Service group. I served as the Treasurer for the group for 3 months.

volunteer.title: Member & Group Leader
volunteer.description: Served as a group leader for the First Aid Rescue group during the 3 week NYSC orientation camp.

recent.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
recent.description: Responsible for the architecture and development of embedded systems for space applications. Leading subsystem integration on satellite missions, including component selection, communication bus design, and software architecture planning.

recent.title: Robotics Researcher and Instructor
recent.description: Taught trainees in robotics department covering 3D design, electronics, microcontroller programming with C++, Python programming, control systems, and robot kinematics. Supervised student research implementations and project development.

recent.title: Electrical/Automation Engineer
recent.description: Worked on the repair and maintenance of industrial equipment including double girder cranes, pumps, motors, hydraulic systems, and electrical grid systems. Gained valuable experience in industrial automation and manufacturing processes.

projects.title: Robotic Seed Planter
projects.description: An autonomous UGV designed to plant seeds efficiently across agricultural fields. This final-year undergraduate project combined mechatronic control, path planning, and seed dispensing mechanisms and was later published in the IAES International Journal of Robotics and Automation (IJRA).

projects.title: Surveillance Drone with Visual Detection
projects.description: Designed a multi-component surveillance drone capable of human detection using MobileNet SSD algorithm and server-based control software. The drone was designed using Fusion 360 for 3D modeling and simulated in ANSYS for aerodynamic and structural performance. MobileNet SSD was used because of its lightweight design and ability to run efficiently on resource constrained processors.

projects.title: Quadruped Robot (Dog-like)
projects.description: Collaborated with two separate teams to build separate quadruped robots driven by servo motor actuators with encoders.

projects.title: Industrial MObile Robotic Platform, IMORP
projects.description: Designed a four-wheel suspension system with independent double wishbone suspension and steerable front/rear wheels for improved maneuverability, for the IMORP rover. The model was optimized for scalability between 3D-printed and full-scale builds.

projects.title: Human Detection Surveillance and IoT System
projects.description: Developed a multithreaded surveillance system for real-time person detection using MobileNet SSD computer vision algorithm, supporting multiple IP camera feeds, live view, intruder video history, and device control via server-based management.

projects.title: FWARP, First Responder Drone
projects.description: Developed a fixed-wing aircraft for quick and stealthy delivery of emergency medical aid to remote or difficult to access areas like military personnel in a war zone or refugee camps, without drawing too much attention.

projects.title: Exoskeleton Prototype
projects.description: Developed an exoskeleton exercise arm for upper limb deformation in humans, with a focus on Erb's Palsy. The device used servo motors, a microcontroller, and a web-based platform to provide precise control.

recent.title: Design and Development of an Unmanned Ground Vehicle for Seed Planting
recent.venue: IAES International Journal of Robotics and Automation (IJRA), June 2024

2024.title: Design and Development of an Unmanned Ground Vehicle for Seed Planting
2024.venue: IAES International Journal of Robotics and Automation (IJRA), 2024
2024.abstract: This paper presents the design and implementation of an unmanned ground vehicle capable of autonomous seed planting, integrating mechanical precision with control automation for improved agricultural productivity.

recent.title: Relevance of AI in Surveillance Systems
recent.description: Delivered a comprehensive demonstration of human detection algorithms applied to home surveillance systems, showcasing real-time person detection capabilities and their impact on security and alertness.

recent.title: Suspension Systems for Robotic Platforms
recent.description: Presented the design and analysis of double wishbone suspension systems for mobile robotic platforms, demonstrating how advanced suspension mechanisms significantly enhance exploration and industrial robot performance.

2024.title: Relevance of AI in Surveillance Systems
2024.abstract: Delivered a comprehensive demonstration of human detection algorithms applied to home surveillance systems. The presentation showcased real-time person detection capabilities using MobileNet SSD, highlighting the integration of computer vision and IoT technologies for improved security and alertness in residential environments.

2024.title: Suspension Systems for Robotic Platforms
2024.abstract: Presented the design and analysis of a double wishbone independent suspension system, with focus on the Industrial Mobile Robotic Platform (IMORP). The talk explored how advanced suspension mechanisms significantly enhance terrain adaptability, stability, and operational efficiency in both exploration and industrial robotics applications.

2022.title: Robotics in First Responder Systems and Life-Saving Applications
2022.abstract: Explored the critical role of robotics and artificial intelligence in emergency response and life-saving operations. The presentation highlighted the Fixed-Wing Autonomous Response Platform (FWARP), demonstrating how autonomous aerial systems can deliver emergency medical aid to remote or inaccessible areas, particularly in conflict zones and disaster scenarios.

2022.title: Medical Robotics: Assistive Technologies for Rehabilitation
2022.abstract: Discussed the transformative role of robotics in medical applications, with emphasis on assistive and rehabilitation technologies. The presentation featured an exoskeleton prototype designed for upper limb rehabilitation in Erb's Palsy patients, demonstrating how mechatronic systems can provide targeted therapeutic interventions for neuromuscular conditions.
